Posts.Content: May 2, 2008 01:10PM jengoll wrote: Is neulasta only given with a/c.  I did not get this with Taxotere.  However that alone gave me bone pain.  I'm getting ready to start the a/c.  Does everybody have to get the shot.  Can they give it to you in your port?
Posts.Title: Bone pain in second week with Neulasta? formygirls SpecialK

Posts.Content: May 2, 2008 02:22PM jengoll wrote: Thank you Lee and Lorena, I had not really heard about this before.  So I wanted to make sure I wasn't missing something :)  So in a nutshell it is used to keep your blood count up?
Posts.Title: Bone pain in second week with Neulasta? formygirls SpecialK

Posts.Content: May 2, 2008 06:20PM jengoll wrote: thanks otter.  Very insightful.  I still going hope I don't have to take the shot,  I hear a/c by itself does not goes bone pain.  I'm hoping it is true.  :)
Posts.Title: Bone pain in second week with Neulasta? formygirls SpecialK

Posts.Content: May 2, 2008 04:05PM jengoll wrote: I was on Taxotere,  gained about 8lbs.  It really seemed like it showed up over night.  Fortunately,  I dropped them pretty fast as well.  It took about a month for it to come off.  It was definitely all water weight.
Posts.Title: Taxotere weight gain and fluid retention chancleta duffyzmom

Posts.Content: May 2, 2008 06:06PM jengoll wrote: Hello -  There is a pattern to Taxotere.  It's crazy how predictable it was each time.  First two days I felt great.  3rd day it hit me like a brick.  I would become very tired.  Slight nauseau all day.  Then on the 6th day I would have aches and pains for about 5 days.  It hurt more at night.  After about the 16th I was starting to feel pretty good again.  I could enjoy that for about 5 days and then go back.  The last one was the hardest.  I got to take a break this time.  I had my surgery in between.  Which was a week ago.  So I have been off chemo for about 2 months.  I did lose all my hair, but kept my most of my eyelashes and lost a good amount of eyebrow.  I'm starting a/c on the 27th.  How was that?  Did you have surgery at the beginning?
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects vs. A/C effects osufan otter

Posts.Content: May 3, 2008 02:41AM jengoll wrote: Hi Desi, I just found out that my cancer went to my lymph nodes as well. I also had scattered fragments around the tumor area. I had a radical mastectomy last wedesnday.  My oncologist said I have the option to have another surgery to remove more of my lymph nodes.  However she believes the chemo and radiation should clean things up.  I was researching this website, because I had the same concerns as you.  I'm really not sure if there is a right or wrong answer at this time.  I chose not to have another surgery and hope this is the right decision.

Posts.Content: May 2, 2008 03:45PM jengoll wrote: My oncologist told me it was fine to have a drink as well.  I actually still can enjoy a glass of red wine about 8 days after the infusion. This was on Taxotere anyway.  I'm not sure if it will be the same once I start the a/c.  I agree though moderation is key.  Listen to your body.  Chemo makes us feel bad enough,  I don't like to make it any worse.
